text: 33cl bottle shared at home. Somewhat pale brown with a full slightly off-white head. Light body with moderate carbonation. Light bitter and sweet tones. Caramel, malts, rye, subtle raisin and straw. Pretty good for its low ABV.

Dark blond to copper in colour. Fairly thin bodied and gassy. Nice dry bitter finish
 Good summer beer.

330ml bottle. Clear, amber colour with average to huge, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Spicy rye aroma, grassy hoppy overtones, a touch of red berries. Taste is moderately bitter grassy hoppy, minimally dusty yeasty, spicy hints of rye; fizzy carbonation, rather watery.

33cl bottle at home from Biernavigatie.nl. Nose is fruity lagerish malty. Body is clear copper, head is very big, offwhite, rocky, fully lasting, good lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, honey, medicine, leaves. Light sweet, medium bitter. Finish is long lasting hoppy heavy bitter, quite watery. Light body, thin texture, lively carbonation. Easy light beer, simple, very bitter, bit out of balance, not bad.

33cl from Douberd, thanks Christos! Hazy golden amber colour, off-white head. Aroma of light floral hops, light malty. Flavour is light sweet, light malty, bitter nuts, light aluminium, light floral, some citrus, dry bitter finish. A bit like Green Orval without the wild yeast. And less tasty. Still nice on a hot day though. Slightly over - carbonated.

(De Natte Gijt 7e Gijtje SRS) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 2.5%
Deep orange to red copper coloured body, crystal clear, with a bug and thick white head on top, good retention. Aroma of malts, light citrus, rye.
Taste of rye, citrus, orange peel, faint tangerine, malts. Quite bitter.
Medium thin body with high carbonation.Okay.

Gushing (!) to huge, fluffy, whipped eggwhite-like head over clear reddish-amber beer. Spicy/herbal nose, malts, toasted malts, parsley, shoots. Bitterish-sweetish, caramel, toast. Peppery finish. Good balance. Light body, spritzy carbonation, refreshing if served not too lukewarm. This is actually quite good! Dont seem to get much of the rye, however.
Bottle at home. Aroma is rye bread, malt, caramel, fruity notes, floral, some citrus, herbal notes. Flavour is light sweet with a bitter finish. Body is light, watery. Fairly enjoyable beer.

0.33 l bottle from De Bierkoning, best before May 2017. Clear, golden amber with a massive, dense, stable, tan to white head. Faint, fruity-grassy, minimally floral aroma of straw, lime and peach. Slightly bitter, moderately fruity-grassy and minimally floral taste of straw, lime and peach, followed by a short, grassy, dry and moderately bitter finish. Thin to medium body, spritzy and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, excessive carbonation. Refreshing, never watery, but a bit bland. Surely drinkable but not particularly tasty.

Bottle from het Biermoment, BB 21/05/17, large sample. Hazy amber color, huge rocky head. Aroma of some caramel, spicy and peppery yeast, bit flowery. Dry and spicy in taste, slight caramel. Carbonation gives some extra feel of body, which is good. Probably wont last as long as the BB date says, but quite tasty and pretty good, for such a low ABV.

0,33l fles bij bierboetiek vandaan. Bruin en mistig met een crème schuimkraag. Geur is sinaasappel vanille. Smaak Is herbal citrus achtig. Body is redelijk zeker voor een laag alcoholbiertje. Gistbitter maakt de afdronk wat trekkend en voller. Zeker niet verkeerd.
Thuis. Typisch droog en tikje zurig. Ruikt niet zo lekker, autosmeer en stoffige deurmat. Backlog from 2015/07/09.
Bottle at home. Murky orange, hazy colour, offwhite foamy head. Lightly fruity nose and taste, lightly bitter, no malty base. Very light body, medium carbonation. Meh.
@Bier Festival Tegelen Sep-2015 Korte notities: Aroma sinaasappel snoepje, meer fijn fruit. Smaak is stuk bitterder, sinaasappelwit. Is het net niet, met een zeempje zoet. Aardig wat koolzuur.

Despite the low alcohol percentage, this beer packs a punch. Citrusflavours, the bitter aftertaste and a decent body make it an enjoyable beer. There seems something missing though, causing it to be a bit watery.

Bottled. The aroma has grassy tones, definately rye there, some grain. Orange-red coloured beer with a medium head. The taste is light bitter, bit grassy again. Light, refreshing. Still has some nice body for 2.5%, guess the rye has a positive influence on that part.
Heldere oranje kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, kruiden, mout. Smaakt fruitig, bitter, citrus. Bittere afdronk. Veel koolzuur. Best goed voor dit alcoholpercentage.
Bottle 33cl. Dark amber with a huge off white head. Aroma has hints of smoke and bitterness. The taste is dry and bitter. The aftertaste develops an even more bitter taste.
Bier is mooi amberkleurig. Inschenken vergt wat souplesse want de schuimkraag komt erg snel naar boven. Bier zelf is vol van smaak maar helaas niet echt mijn favoriet.

33cl flesje via 8 Zaligheden, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 2,5%
Uitgeschonken in Kaapse Brouwers glas

Uiterlijk: amberkleurig met dikke schuimkraag 

Aroma en smaak: hoppige neus, smaak is straf bitter, nootachtig, bloemig 

Conclusie: toegegeven erg veel smaak voor 2,5%

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Chouffe glass:
Creamy head. Hazy orange amber body.
Aromas of malts, pils ish, herbs...
Flavour is thin, some malts, bitters, herbs...
Meh...
Aftertaste is bitter, grassy, herbal...
Medium carbo, foamy mouthfeel, low bodied.
Meh...
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle. Amber color. Soft rye aroma with floral hops. Thin and watery but well hopped with floral citric hops. Hints of rye and red fruit. Nice and tasty low alcohol beer.
Weinig neus: hint van caramel. Smaak erg tegenvallend. Eigenlijk alleen hop in water. Zeker niet wat je van een rye saison verwacht.

33cl Bottle. Appearance: dark orange with a large off white head
Aroma: rye, malts, citrus, 
Taste: malts providing some moderate sweetness, citrus and herbal big bitterness, with some rye.
lively carbonation, thin, dry.

Not really a saison.

Bottle, pours dark orange with a large off white head. Aroma: light barnyard, citrus, spices. Taste follows with a bit of biscuit, rye, herbs. light sweet, medium bitter, lively carbonation, a bit watery (not surprising at 2.5% abv) but still a lot of taste. Dry herbal finish. Well done.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours dark orange with white head. 
Aroma rye, spice, citrus, floral. 
Taste fresh citrus bitter. Some sweets. 
Mouthfeel thin, dry. 
Great session brew.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy amber colored brew with an dry bitter taste, hints of citrus and the greasiness of rye. If you want a good tasty low-alcohol brew, so this one of them.
Goud oranje bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt zoet, kruidig. Als een belgisch blond. Smaakt kruidig, hop, fruitig. Lekker!

Bottle thanks to Deanso. Hazy amber with big off white head. Floral, lemon peel, lots of bitter herbs and some endive. No sweetness, just bitterness. Light bodied with dry feel and quite some carbonation.

33cl bottle from ABCBeers, shared with Kermis & Maakun.
Veryt hin white head. Hazy amber pour. Very bitter. More of a session IPA than a session saison.
Bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Pours slightly hazy amber with an off white head. Aroma of malt, rye and light citrus. Flavour is heavy bitter. Thin watery bodied with soft carbonation.

Draught @ Bier & Big festival Eindhoven. Clear rusty orange color, medium sized white to off-white head. Aroma has a lot of malts and a lot of rye, slightly wort. Taste malts, again rye strongly, firm bitterness and fi bitter hops. Wouldnt recognise this as a saison, but its certainly not bad.

33cl bottle at home, poured a deep cloudy orange to dark Amber colour with a fluffy white head. Nose is filled with citrus, sweet crisp malts, grapefruit, orange Peel, spiced rye. Spiced finish in the end wich should be the rye. Pretty boring and watery taste. There are way better low abv beers. Just cant get behind the citrus. Meh..
